body.p: A CMS or an customization can automatically manage some XML attributes, so the user cannot modify them. For example, a CMS can generate an id attribute for each element that is used to link the element to the CMS database.

To hide such attributes from the user interface, you can use the server-side ro.sync.ecss.extensions.api.attributes.AuthorAttributesDisplayFilter Java API. The attributes will still be visible in the text page. You can also remove the text page.
